FuncDef: The display mld snooping command displays MLD snooping parameter settings, including default and non-default parameter settings. The display mld snooping command displays MLD snooping parameter settings, including default and non-default parameter settings. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays non-default MLD snooping parameter settings.
-

Displays MLD snooping parameter settings of a specified VLAN.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
To check MLD snooping parameter settings, run the display mld snooping command. The command output helps you locate multicast service faults.
The command can display MLD snooping parameter settings of a VLAN only if the VLAN is in the Up state.
When using the display mld snooping command, note the following points:
